Description: Body and stemmed foot sherd (mended from five fragments) of Chian pottery Ionian cup with everted rim; white slip; interior: glazed streaky black (partly worn); added red bands lined in white at top of wall, mid-wall and on floor; exterior: lip glazed with traces of myrtle wreath in added white; handle zone reserved with dilute line at top; wall glazed with one reserved band; outside of foot glazed, underside reserved, unslipped; inscription on exterior. Two drill hole for analysis.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1965,0930.400.a,1924,1201.188, Oxford AN1925.608e(3) and Boston MFA 1888.1081. For parallels regarding Ionian cups with myrtle wreaths, see British Museum 1888,0601.271 and 1924,1201.1280, both are from Naukratis. Paper label marked '23'.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1905) (phase 2)
